revised_title: Finger and Toe Disease: A Study on Cabbage and Cruciferous Plants
tldr: This article discusses the 'finger and toe' disease that affects cabbage and other cruciferous plants. The author, George Massee, explains that the disease is caused by a minute organism related to fungi, Plasmodiophora brassicae. The disease is influenced by the amount of lime in the soil, with low lime content promoting the disease. The author also shares experiments conducted at Kew, demonstrating the effects of different soil treatments on the development of the disease.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Plant Pathology
